component.name: functions
component.subComponents:
<component name="DELETE_asset_v1_content_assets_"> DELETE_asset_v1_content_assets_.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/routes.htm#detail_deleteAsset
Deletes a category by ID.

component.name: DELETE_asset_v1_content_categories_{categoryId}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteCategory.htm
Deletes one Content Builder category by ID.

component.name: DELETE_interaction_v1_eventDefinitions_key:{eventDefinitionKey}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Deletes an individual event definition by key.

component.name: DELETE_interaction_v1_eventDefinitions_{eventDefinitionId}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Deletes an individual event definition by ID.

component.name: DELETE_interaction_v1_interactions_{id}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteInteractionById.htm
Deletes a journey by ID. When deleting last version of a journey, check if the journey is associated with a tag and unassociated the tag using the deleteTags resource.

component.name: DELETE_messaging_v1_email_definitions_{definitionKey}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteMessageDefinition.htm
Deletes a message definition. You can't restore a deleted definition. The deleted definition is archived, and a delete location of the definition key is provided in the response for reference. You can reuse a deleted definition key because the information associated with it is copied to a new unique identifier.

component.name: DELETE_messaging_v1_sms_definitions_{definitionKey}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteSMSMessageDefinition.htm
Deletes a message definition. You can't restore a deleted definition. The deleted definition is archived, and a delete location of the definition key is provided in the response for reference. You can reuse a deleted definition key because the information associated with it is copied to a new unique identifier.

component.name: DELETE_messaging_v1_sms_definitions_{definitionKey}_queue
component.description: https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteQueuedSMSMessagesForDefinition.htm

component.name: DELETE_platform_v1_ens-callbacks_{callbackId}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteCallback.htm
Deletes a registered callback that isn't used by any subscriptions. Delete all subscriptions for the callback before deleting the callback.

component.name: DELETE_platform_v1_ens-subscriptions_{subscriptionId}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteSubscription.htm
Deletes a subscription.

component.name: DELETE_push_v1_location_{et_location_id}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteLocation.htm
Deletes an existing location.

component.name: DELETE_sms_v1_keyword_{et_keyword_id}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteKeywordViaKeywordId.htm
Deletes a keyword on an account given a keyword Id.

component.name: DELETE_sms_v1_keyword_{et_keyword}_{et_sms_shortcode}_US
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/deleteKeywordViaKeywordShortCodeCountryCode.htm
Deletes a keyword on an account given a keyword, short code, and country code.

component.name: GET_asset_v1_content_assets
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/assetSimpleQuery.htm
Gets an asset collection by simple $filter parameters.

component.name: GET_asset_v1_content_assets_salutations
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/content-api.htm
Gets the default header and footer for an account.

component.name: GET_asset_v1_content_assets_{assetId}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/content-api.htm
Gets an asset by ID.

component.name: GET_asset_v1_content_assets_{assetId}_file
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/content-api.htm
Gets the binary file for an asset

component.name: GET_asset_v1_content_assets_{emailId}_salutations
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/content-api.htm
Gets the header and footer for an email.

component.name: GET_asset_v1_content_categories
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getCategories.htm
Returns one or more Content Builder categories that are owned by or reside in your MID. To request categories that have been shared with your MID, add a scope parameter to the call.

component.name: GET_asset_v1_content_categories_{categoryId}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getCategory.htm
Returns one Content Builder category by ID.

component.name: GET_contacts_v1_attributeGroups
component.description: https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/routes.htm

component.name: GET_contacts_v1_contacts_analytics_deleterequests
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/ContactsDeleteRequestsDetails.htm
Retrieves details of contact delete requests for a date range.

component.name: GET_contacts_v1_contacts_analytics_deleterequests_summary
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/ContactsDeleteRequestsSummary.htm
Retrieves a summary of contact delete requests for a date range.

component.name: GET_contacts_v1_schema
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/schemasCollection.htm
Retrieves the collection of all contact data schemas contained in the current account.

component.name: GET_data_v1_async_import_{id}_summary
component.description:
[https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/marketing/marketing-cloud/references/mc-import_job_api?meta=Get+status+of+a+one-time+data+import](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/marketing/marketing-cloud/references/mc-import_job_api?meta=Get%2Bstatus%2Bof%2Ba%2Bone-time%2Bdata%2Bimport)
Get the status of a queued data import by ID.

component.name: GET_data_v1_async_import_{id}_validationresult
component.description:
[https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/marketing/marketing-cloud/references/mc-import_job_api?meta=Get+validation+details+of+a+one-time+data+import](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/marketing/marketing-cloud/references/mc-import_job_api?meta=Get%2Bvalidation%2Bdetails%2Bof%2Ba%2Bone-time%2Bdata%2Bimport)
Get import row level validation details by ID.

component.name: GET_data_v1_async_import_{id}_validationsummary
component.description:
[https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/marketing/marketing-cloud/references/mc-import_job_api?meta=Get+validation+summary+of+a+one-time+data+import](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/marketing/marketing-cloud/references/mc-import_job_api?meta=Get%2Bvalidation%2Bsummary%2Bof%2Ba%2Bone-time%2Bdata%2Bimport)
Get validation summary of a data import by ID.

component.name: GET_data_v1_audit_auditEvents
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getAuditEvents.htm
Retrieves logged Audit Trail audit events for the current account and its children. Logins are audited at the enterprise level.

component.name: GET_data_v1_audit_securityEvents
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSecurityEvents.htm
Retrieves logged Audit Trail security events for the authenticated userâ€™s account and its children. Logins are audited at the enterprise level.

component.name: GET_interaction_v1_eventDefinitions
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Retrieves a collection of event definitions.

component.name: GET_interaction_v1_eventDefinitions_key:{eventDefinitionKey}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Retrieves an individual event definition by key.

component.name: GET_interaction_v1_interactions
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Retrieves a collection of all journeys. The journey collection resources are embedded in the items property of the response body. Use both a sort order and paging to minimize the response size and response time.

component.name: GET_interaction_v1_interactions_publishStatus_{statusId}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getPublishStatus.htm
Checks the status of a publication.

component.name: GET_interaction_v1_interactions_{journeyId}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Retrieves a single journey by ID.

component.name: GET_interaction_v1_interactions_{journeyId}_audit_all
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getInteractionAuditLog.htm
Retrieves an audit log of a journey and its versions by ID or key. Pass in different actions to see history about creating, modifying, activating, deactivating, stopping, and deleting a journey.

component.name: GET_interaction_v1_rest
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Retrieves the discovery document for the collection of journey resources.

component.name: GET_messaging_v1_email_definitions
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getDefinitions.htm
Gets a list of send definitions.

component.name: GET_messaging_v1_email_definitions_{definitionKey}
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSendDefinition.htm
Gets send definition configuration details for a definition key.

component.name: GET_messaging_v1_email_definitions_{definitionKey}_queue
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getQueueMetricsForDefinition.htm
Gets metrics for the messages of a send definition. Applies to messages that are accepted but not yet processed.

component.name: GET_messaging_v1_email_messages_
component.description:
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getMessagesNotSent.htm
Gets a paginated list of messages that were not sent, ordered from oldest to newest.

tsd_external_key:
_deliveryRecords_"> GET_messaging_v1_messageDefinitionSends_key:_deliveryRecords_.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/messageDefinitionSendsDeliveryRecords.htm
Gets the delivery details of an email sent using the MessageDefinitionSends.
GET_messaging_v1_sms_definitions_.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSMSDefinitions.htm
Gets a list of send definitions.
GET_messaging_v1_sms_definitions_{definitionKey}_queue.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSMSQueueMetricsForDefinition.htm
Gets metrics for the messages of a send definition. Applies to messages that are accepted but not yet processed.
GET_messaging_v1_sms_messages_.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSMSMessagesNotSent.htm
Gets a paginated list of messages that were not sent, ordered from oldest to newest.
GET_messaging_v1_sms_messages_{messageKey}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSMSSendStatusForRecipient.htm
Gets the send status for a message. Because this route is rate-limited, use it for infrequent verification of a messageKey. To collect send status at scale, subscribe to transactional send events using the Event Notification Service.
GET_platform_v1_ens-callbacks.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getAllCallbacks.htm
Retrieves details about all registered callbacks.
GET_platform_v1_ens-callbacks_{callbackId}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getCallback.htm
Retrieves details about a registered callback.
GET_platform_v1_ens-subscriptions-by-cb_{callbackId}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getAllSubscriptionsForCallback.htm
Retrieves details for all subscriptions associated with a callback.
GET_platform_v1_ens-subscriptions_{subscriptionId}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSubscription.htm
Retrieves details for a subscription.
GET_push_v1_location_.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getLocations.htm
Gets a list of all locations.
GET_push_v1_location_{et_location_id}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSpecificLocation.htm
ets a specific location.
GET_sms_v1_messageContact_{et_smsmsg_id}_history_{et_sms_tokenId}_mobileNumber_{mobile_number}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getMessageContactHistory.htm
Retrieves the last message sent to a mobile number.
GET_sms_v1_messageList_{et_smsmsg_id}_deliveries_{et_smstoken_id}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getMessageList.htm
Returns status for a message sent to a group of mobile numbers.
GET_v2_discovery.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getBaseURLs.htm
Gets tenant-specific REST and authentication base URIs for the Marketing Cloud tenant associated with the provided username and client ID.
GET_v2_userinfo.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getUserInfo.htm
Gets information for the account and user that are associated with the access token.
GETmessaging_v1_email_messages_{messageKey}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/getSendStatusForRecipient.htm
Gets the send status for a message. Because this route is rate-limited, use it for infrequent verification of a messageKey. To collect send status at scale, subscribe to transactional send events using the Event Notification Service.
<component name="PATCH_asset_v1_content_assets_"> PATCH_asset_v1_content_assets_.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/content-api.htm
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/base-asset-types.htm
Updates part of an asset.
PATCH_contacts_v1_contacts.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/updateContacts.htm
Updates contacts with the specified information in the specified attribute groups.
PATCH_messaging_v1_email_definitions_{definitionKey}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/updateMessageDefinition.htm
Updates a specific message definition.
PATCH_messaging_v1_sms_definitions_{definitionKey}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/updateSMSMessageDefinition.htm
Updates a specific message definition.
POST_address_v1_validateEmail.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/validateEmail.htm
Validates an email by specifying the email address and validators to be used in the request body of the HTTP POST. You can use more than one validator in the same call.
POST_asset_v1_content_assets.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/content-api.htm
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/base-asset-types.htm
Inserts an asset.
POST_asset_v1_content_assets_query.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/assetAdvancedQuery.htm
A complex query is comprised of two or more simple queries joined with an AND or OR logical comparison operator. The simple queries are contained in a leftOperand JSON field and rightOperand JSON field. A third field, the logicalOperator, is used to compare the two operands. You can also embed queries inside other queries.
POST_asset_v1_content_categories.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createCategory.htm
Creates a category (folder) in Content Builder.
POST_contacts_v1_addresses_email_search.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/retrieveContactKey.htm
Retrieves the contact key for one or more email channel addresses.
POST_contacts_v1_contacts.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createContacts.htm
Creates a new contact with the specified information in the specified attribute groups.
POST_contacts_v1_contacts_actions_delete.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/DeleteByContactKeys.htm
Deletes contacts based on specified contact key values. This operation runs asynchronously. Use the OperationID value returned to check the status of the delete.
POST_data_v1_async_import.xml [https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/marketing/marketing-cloud/references/mc-import_job_api?meta=Queue+and+start+a+one-time+data+import](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/marketing/marketing-cloud/references/mc-import_job_api?meta=Queue%2Band%2Bstart%2Ba%2Bone-time%2Bdata%2Bimport)
Queue and start a one-time import against a data extension without creating an import definition.
Note: If the file is on enhanced FTP, it will be removed once import finishes.
For testing purpose, it's advised to try with enhanced ftp file import first and then adapt other part by yourself.
POST_hub_v1_dataevents_key:{DE_External_Key}_rowset.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postDataExtensionRowsetByKey.htm
The API upserts multiple data extension rows in a single synchronous call using Data Extension's External Key.
POST_hub_v1_dataevents_{DE_ID}_rowset.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postDataExtensionRowsetByKey.htm
The API upserts multiple data extension rows in a single synchronous call using Data Extension ID.
POST_hub_v1_dataeventsasync_key:{DE_External_Key}_rowset.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postDataExtensionRowsetByKey.htm
The API upserts a multiple data extension rows Asynchronously using Data Extension's External Key.
POST_hub_v1_dataeventsasync_{DE_ID}_rowset.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postDataExtensionRowsetByKey.htm
The API upserts a multiple data extension rows Asynchronously using Data Extension's ID.
POST_interaction_v1_eventDefinitions.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createEventDefinition.htm
Creates an event definition (name and data schema for an event) and defines an event definition key. The resource uses this key when firing an event to send it to the appropriate journey. Typically, marketers create the event definition in the Journey Builder UI. Use this resource instead if you are using a custom application for Journey Builder functionality.
POST_interaction_v1_events.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postEvent.htm
Fires the entry event that initiates the journey.
POST_interaction_v1_interactions.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postCreateInteraction.htm
Creates or saves a journey. To create a new journey provide the request body in the appropriate Journey Specification. Please read the Journey Spec page to understand which properties are required to create a journey via the API. The id, key, createdDate, modifiedDate, status and definitionId are assigned by Journey Builder and are never to be passed in as parameters for creating a journey.
POST_interaction_v1_interactions_contactMembership.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/contactMembershipRequest.htm
Provides a list of journeys and journey versions for a list of contact keys.
POST_interaction_v1_interactions_contactexit.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/contactExitRequest.htm
Removes up to 50 contacts from a journey or from one or more versions of a journey.
POST_interaction_v1_interactions_contactexit_status.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/contactExitStatus.htm
Returns the status of a request to remove a contact from a journey or from one or more versions of a journey.
POST_interaction_v1_interactions_journeyhistory_download.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/contactMembershipRequest.htm
Provides a list of journeys and journey versions for a list of contact keys.
POST_interaction_v1_interactions_publishAsync_{journeyId}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postPublishInteractionById.htm
Publishes a journey version asynchronously.
POST_interaction_v1_interactions_stop_{journeyId}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postStopInteractionById.htm
Stops a running journey.
POST_messaging_v1_email_definitions.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createSendDefinition.htm
Creates a send definition.
POST_messaging_v1_email_messages.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/sendMessageMultipleRecipients.htm
Sends a message to multiple recipients using a send definition. You can provide a messageKey in the request; otherwise, the messageKey is automatically generated in the response.
POST_messaging_v1_email_messages_{guid}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/sendMessageSingleRecipient.htm
Sends a message to a single recipient via a send definition using a messageKey path parameter.
<component name="POST_messaging_v1_messageDefinitionSends_key:_send"> POST_messaging_v1_messageDefinitionSends_key:_send.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/messageDefinitionSends.htm
Sends transactional email using Marketing Cloud's triggered send functionality. In order to use this service, configure a triggered send definition in Email Studio.
POST_messaging_v1_sms_definitions.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createSMSSendDefinition.htm
Creates a send definition.
POST_messaging_v1_sms_messages.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/sendSMSMessageMultipleRecipients.htm
Sends a message to multiple recipients using a send definition. You can provide a messageKey in the request; otherwise, the messageKey is automatically generated in the response.
POST_messaging_v1_sms_messages_{guid}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/sendSMSMessageSingleRecipient.htm
Sends a message to a single recipient via a send definition using a messageKey path parameter.
POST_platform_v1_ens-callbacks.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createCallback.htm
Registers a new callback to receive event notifications. Verify your callback before you can use it in a subscription.
POST_platform_v1_ens-subscriptions.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createSubscription.htm
Creates a single subscription. A subscription indicates which event types to receive notifications for and which callback, or webhook, to receive them on. A new subscription can take up to two minutes to become active. You can create a subscription only for a verified callback.
POST_platform_v1_ens-verify.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/verifyCallback.htm
Verifies a callback so that it can receive notifications.
POST_push_v1_location.xml This is POST_push_v1_location operation.
POST_push_v1_message.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createPushMessage.htm
Creates a push message template for sending to a list of subscribers or an audience inclusion list or data extension. You can personalize each message for each subscriber using personalization strings or AMPscript lookups from a data extension within a single push message definition. You can also pass the text of the message to override the message contents specified in the definition for API-driven personalization.
POST_push_v1_messageApp_{mobilepush_message_id}_send.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postMessageAppSend.htm
Broadcasts a message to all users of a push-enabled app.
POST_push_v1_messageList_{mobilepush_message_id}_send.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postMessageListSend.htm
Sends a message to the specified mobile devices of a push-enabled app.
POST_sms_v1_contacts_subscriptions.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/contactsSubscriptions.htm
Returns subscription status for a mobile number or subscriber key.
POST_sms_v1_keyword.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/createKeyword.htm
Creates a keyword on an account.
POST_sms_v1_messageContact_{sms_message_id}_send.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postMessageContactSend.htm
Initiates a message to one or more mobile numbers.
POST_sms_v1_message_optin.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/messageOptIn.htm
Creates an SMS opt-in message permitting contacts to subscribe to further SMS messages.
POST_sms_v1_queueMO.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/postQueueMO.htm
Queues an MO message for send.
POST_v2_token.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-app-development.meta/mc-app-development/access-token-s2s.htm
When the access token expires, your application must request a new access token using the same v2/token route as before. The lifetime of an access token is 20 minutes.
PUT_asset_v1_content_categories_{categoryId}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/updateCategory.htm
Updates one Content Builder category by ID.
PUT_hub_v1_dataevents_key:key:{DE_External_Key}_rows_Email:example@example.com.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/putDataExtensionRowByKey.htm
Upserts a data extension row by primary key using Data Extension's External Key.
PUT_hub_v1_dataevents_key:{DE_External_Key}_rows_Email:someone@exacttarget.com_column_FollowerCount_increment.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/putIncrementColumnValueByKey.htm
The API increments a numeric column in a single synchronous call using Data Extension's External Key.
PUT_hub_v1_dataevents_{DE_ID}_rows_Email:example@example.com.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/putDataExtensionRowByKey.htm
Upserts a data extension row by primary key using Data Extension ID.
PUT_hub_v1_dataevents_{DE_ID}_rows_Email:someone@exacttarget.com_column_FollowerCount_increment.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/putIncrementColumnValueByKey.htm
The API increments a numeric column in a single synchronous call using Data Extension ID.
PUT_hub_v1_dataeventsasync_key:{DE_External_Key}_rows_Email:example@example.com.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/putDataExtensionRowByKey.htm
Upserts a data extension row by primary key using Data Extension's External Key.
PUT_hub_v1_dataeventsasync_key:{DE_External_Key}_rows_Email:someone@exacttarget.com_column_FollowerCount_increment.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/putIncrementColumnValueByKey.htm
The API increments a numeric column in a single Asynchronous call using Data Extension's External Key.
PUT_hub_v1_dataeventsasync_{DE_ID}_rows_Email:example@example.com.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/putDataExtensionRowByKey.htm
Upserts a data extension row by primary key using Data Extension ID.
PUT_hub_v1_dataeventsasync_{DE_ID}_rows_Email:someone@exacttarget.com_column_FollowerCount_increment.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/putIncrementColumnValueByKey.htm
The API increments a numeric column in a single Asynchronous call using Data Extension's ID.
PUT_interaction_v1_eventDefinitions_key:{eventDefinitionKey}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Updates an event definition by key. Once an event definition is created, only a few properties can be updated.
PUT_interaction_v1_eventDefinitions_{eventDefinitionId}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/jb-api-specification.htm
Updates an event definition by ID. Once an event definition is created, only a few properties can be updated.
PUT_platform_v1_ens-callbacks.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/updateCallback.htm
Updates a registered callback. It can take up to two minutes for callback changes to become active.
PUT_platform_v1_ens-subscriptions.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/updateSubscription.htm
Updates a single subscription. To pause an active subscription, set the status request parameter to paused. To unpause a paused subscription, set the status request parameter to active. Always supply a status reason in the request when you update the subscription status. Changes made to a subscription can take up to two minutes to become active.
PUT_push_v1_location_{et_location_id}.xml https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.noversion.mc-apis.meta/mc-apis/updateLocation.htm
Updates an existing location by ID.
